climbs.name: High on Waffles... or old school route?
climbs.fa: Jacob Dolence Early 2012... or someone else a long time ago.

content.description: This route climbs better than it looks, an overhanging boulder right off the trail. Start with compression moves and head straight up the prow of the boulder towards a big jug below the lip.

Start at the skirt and work features to a crappy right hand sloper. Bust a hard move to a unique pinch and press it out with great crimps. Way fun. 

  Video beta 

m.facebook.com/story.php?st…
content.location: Scavenger hunt. Near the apex of the loop

content.description: Crux is in the first few moves.  Sit start on crimps and follow up to the apex of the boulder.
content.location: Down and behind high on waffles.  Obvious beautiful overhanging face with perfect crimps.  Potential for a harder route to the right

content.description:
Climb out the left edge of the round basin, linking it to the seam above with a technical slab sequence. Grade and height are ballpark, be comfortable with thoughtful climbing off the deck if attempting. An obvious and brilliant line that usually rests in obscurity. 

  Video beta 

m.facebook.com/story.php?st…
content.location: Look for this large block in a clearing below the trail when nearing the apex from the east leg of the loop.

content.description: This area is at the top of the trail.  Home to quite a few good boulder problems.
